official-title.#text:
To ensure the effectiveness of the missile defense system
		  of the United States, and for other purposes.

committee-name.#tail: , and in addition to the Committee on

, for a
			 period to be subsequently determined by the Speaker, in each case for
			 consideration of such provisions as fall within the jurisdiction of the
			 committee concerned

cosponsor.#tail:
) introduced the following
			 bill; which was referred to the

short-title.#text:
Protecting U.S. Missile Defense
			 Information Act of 2013

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

header.#text:
Report and
			 briefings on missile defense discussions between the United States and the
			 Russian Federation

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall
			 submit to the congressional defense committees a semi-annual report on any
			 discussions on missile defense between the United States Government and the
			 Government of the Russian Federation during the preceding 6-month
			 period.

shall include the following with respect to any such
			 discussions:
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Protecting U.S. Missile Defense Information Act of 2013/s:2/ss:a

text.#text:
The date or dates
			 of the discussions.

The official or
			 officials of each government taking part in the discussions.

A
			 copy of any documents or other materials exchanged during or as a result of the
			 discussions.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall be submitted not later than 180 days after the
			 date of the enactment of this Act and in addition to addressing any such
			 discussions during the preceding 6-month period shall also address any such
			 discussions during the 10-year period ending on the date of the enactment of
			 this Act.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Protecting U.S. Missile Defense Information Act of 2013/s:2/ss:a

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall be submitted in unclassified form, but
			 may contain a classified annex, if necessary.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Protecting U.S. Missile Defense Information Act of 2013/s:2/ss:a

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: , the
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Protecting U.S. Missile Defense Information Act of 2013/s:2/ss:a

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall
			 brief the congressional defense committees on the matters contained in the
			 report and any other matters relating to the report that the
determines to be appropriate.

text.#text:
In conjunction with
			 the submission of the report required by

header.#text:
Reports and
			 briefings on declassification of certain missile defense information

			 submit to the congressional defense committees a semi-annual report on meetings
			 held by the

with respect to declassifying

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Protecting U.S. Missile Defense Information Act of 2013/s:3/ss:a

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: during the meeting.

text.#text:
A description of the documents considered
			 by the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
with respect to declassifying such documents, including a
			 summary of the reasoning used to make such determination.

shall be submitted not later than 180 days after the
			 date of the enactment of this Act and in addition to addressing any such
			 meetings during the preceding 6-month period shall also address any such
			 meetings during the 10-year period ending on the date of the enactment of this
			 Act.

text.#text:
In conjunction with
			 the submission of the report required by

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
may be used to
			 provide the Russian Federation with access to information regarding—

text.#text:
None of the funds
			 authorized to be appropriated or otherwise made available for fiscal year 2014
			 or any fiscal year thereafter for the

header.#text:
Limitation on
			 funds to provide the Russian Federation with access to certain missile defense
			 technology

text.#text:
missile defense technology of the United
			 States relating to hit-to-kill technology; or

telemetry data
			 with respect to missile defense interceptors or target vehicles.

header.#text:
Limitation on
			 funds to negotiate or implement executive agreements relating to United States
			 missile defense capabilities

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
declares that
			 the United States shall not be bound, politically or otherwise, by the terms of
			 any executive agreement relating to the missile defense capabilities of the
			 United States, including basing, locations, capabilities, and numbers of
			 missiles with respect to such missile defense capabilities.
may be used—

text.#text:
None of the funds
			 authorized to be appropriated or otherwise made available for fiscal year 2014
			 or any fiscal year thereafter for the

to negotiate or
			 implement any executive agreement relating to the missile defense capabilities
			 of the United States, including basing, locations, capabilities, and numbers of
			 missiles with respect to such missile defense capabilities; or

to implement rules
			 of engagement or Guidance for Employment of Force relating to such executive
			 agreement.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall not apply with respect to the use of funds to negotiate or implement any
			 executive agreement with a country with respect to which the United States has
			 entered into a treaty of alliance or has a security guarantee.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Protecting U.S. Missile Defense Information Act of 2013/s:5/ss:b

term.#tail: means an international agreement other than—

text.#text:
an agreement that
			 is in the form of a treaty under article II, section 2, clause 2 of the
			 Constitution of the United States; or

an agreement that requires implementing
			 legislation to be enacted into law for the agreement to enter into force with
			 respect to the United States.

header.#text:
Disclosure of and
			 report on Russian Federation support of ballistic missile defense programs of
			 China, Syria, Iran, and North Korea

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall seek to encourage the Government of
			 the Russian Federation to disclose any support by the Russian Federation or
			 Russian entities for the ballistic missile programs of the People’s Republic of
			 China, Syria, Iran, or North Korea.

shall
			 submit to the congressional defense committees a semi-annual report on any
			 disclosure by the Government of the Russian Federation of any such support
			 during the preceding 6-month period.

shall be
			 submitted not later than 180 days after the date of the enactment of this Act
			 and in addition to addressing any such support during the preceding 6-month
			 period shall also address any such support during the 10-year period ending on
			 the date of the enactment of this Act.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Protecting U.S. Missile Defense Information Act of 2013/s:6/ss:b

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall
			 be submitted in unclassified form, but may contain a classified annex, if
			 necessary.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Protecting U.S. Missile Defense Information Act of 2013/s:6/ss:b

term.#tail:
has the
			 meaning given that term in
